meanings.definition: The act or state of touching or meeting.
meanings.sent1: During the game, there was physical contact between the players.
meanings.sent2: I made eye contact with my friend across the room.
meanings.sent3: The contact of our hands during the handshake was warm and friendly.
meanings.sent4: The contact of our ideas sparked a creative collaboration.
meanings.sent5: The contact of the cold water sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: Communication or interaction between people or things.
meanings.sent1: We lost contact after she moved to a different city.
meanings.sent2: I need to get in contact with the customer service department.
meanings.sent3: The aliens made contact with Earth in a surprising way.
meanings.sent4: The contact between the two cultures led to a beautiful exchange of traditions.
meanings.sent5: The contact through the phone was clear and easy to understand.

meanings.definition: A person who can be reached for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: The emergency contact for the school is the principal.
meanings.sent2: I have the contact information for the event organizer.
meanings.sent3: The contact for the job interview was very helpful and informative.
meanings.sent4: She is the main contact for all our questions about the project.
meanings.sent5: The contact for the company always responds quickly to emails.
